chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C Blader was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph C Blader is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph C Blader was found guilty of Attempt 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Under go an assessment for sex offender risk and follow through with recommendations. Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry. Will leave contact with minors up to the agent.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Continue with counseling.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

timeConds.notes: Serve 60 days and stay the balance. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked. Huber for work and treatment. May serve in Marquette County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
